courses.title: Communication
courses.prerequisite: For all 010 courses: Satisfactory scores on English portion of ACT test and TSI examination or ENGL 0301. For ENGL 1302, a grade of 'C' or better in ENGL 1301.
courses.notes: See General Education Core for more details. Option: ENGL 1301

courses.title: Creative Arts
courses.notes: Recommended: ENGL 2314 Appreciation & Analysis of Literature

courses.title: Mathematics
courses.prerequisite: College Ready TSI status in Mathematics or MATH 0314/0332/0342.
courses.notes: See General Education Core for course options. Recommended: MATH 1332 Math for Liberal Arts or MATH 1324 Mathematics for Business & Social Sciences

courses.title: Learning Framework
courses.notes: As required, based on credit hours earned, TSI status, High School rank, major declaration. May apply as free elective.

courses.title: Communication
courses.prerequisite: For all 010 courses: Satisfactory scores on English portion of ACT test and TSI examination or ENGL 0301. For ENGL 1302, a grade of 'C' or better in ENGL 1301.

courses.notes: May apply pending course selection. See General Education Core for course options. 1 credit hour of lab may apply to category 090.

courses.notes: See General Education Core for course options. Recommended: ANTH 2351, PHIL 1362, ECON 1301 or ECON 2301

courses.title: Spanish Language
courses.prerequisite: Students are placed into a sequence and a level based on the proficiency exam or departmental approval. If a student earns a score that earns credit beyond SPAN 2315, they may take the next or higher-level Spanish course and it will still fulfill the Spanish course requirement. Please refer student to MAS undergraduate coordinator for substitution.
